sentences.english: He learned carelessly and was not hard-working at all.
sentences.chinese: 他学习马马虎虎，很不用功。

sentences.english: Hereafter, the blue army god lamp's two feet long-range are also create an incident tigerishly .
sentences.chinese: 此后，蓝军神灯的两脚远射也是虎虎生风。

sentences.english: He tinkered with my old clock.
sentences.chinese: 他马马虎虎地修理我的旧钟。

sentences.english: Don't palter with this question, answer it properly.
sentences.chinese: 不要马马虎虎地对待这个问题，好好回答。

sentences.english: He was castigated for his carelessness in doing homework.
sentences.chinese: 他由于做作业时马马虎虎而受到申斥。

sentences.english: He does his work anyhow, without taking any care or trouble over it.
sentences.chinese: 他干起活来马马虎虎，既不当心，又不认真。

sentences.english: B. Just so-so. Are you still working at your old company?
sentences.chinese: 马马虎虎。你还在原来的公司上班吗？

sentences.english: There is warmth in many of the late-summer flowers.
sentences.chinese: 许多夏末开放的花儿也虎虎有生。

sentences.english: Products must be strictly, not carelessly, inspected before they leave the factory.
sentences.chinese: 产品出厂要严格检查，马马虎虎可不行。

sentences.english: Don’t scamp your work because you are pressed for time.
sentences.chinese: 不要因为时间仓促而马马虎虎。

sentences.english: Inside the car, the grandfather took Huhu in his arms and stroked her soft hair.
sentences.chinese: 老人坐在车里，把虎虎搂在怀里，摸着它的小软毛。

sentences.english: In the athletic competition he acted powerfully, and won a lot of applause.
sentences.chinese: 他在竞技比赛时虎虎生风，赢得了很多喝彩声。

sentences.english: The female knot-tying weaverbird will refuse to mate with a male who has built a shoddy nest.
sentences.chinese: 会打结的雌织巢鸟不肯同造窝马马虎虎的雄鸟交配。

sentences.english: We went hitchhiking for two weeks and lived catch - as - catch - can.
sentences.chinese: 我们搭便车旅行两周，生活过得马马虎虎。

sentences.english: It was just so-so on the software side.
sentences.chinese: 这只是马马虎虎在软件方面。
汤姆马马虎虎地把钟修了一下。

definition: the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
lucky star in the ascendant (idiom); a lucky sign
our luck is in, everything is going smoothly (idiom)
lit. dragon soaring and tiger leaping (idiom)/fig. prosperous and bustling/vigorous and active
to have one's wishes come true/wish you the best!
to have all one's wishes (idiom)/best wishes/all the best/may all your hopes be fulfilled
one of the twelve animals symbolic of the earthly branches 地支[di4 zhi1]/animal from the Chinese zodiac
